The MSB in the ampules was sampled and analyzed for TCE.The effects of PM-100 clay on TCE degradation In order to determine the effect of TCE adsorption to PM-100 on the TCE-degrading ability by G4, three concentrations of TCE (10, 20 and 30ppm) were employed. A 1g of the clay was added to each 10ml ampule using a spatula. Sterile MSB (2.5ml) was added to the ampules and TCE was added in the form of a TCE–methanol solution. All ampules were immediately sealed without the addition of G4 and incubated for 24h on an orbital shaker to allow TCE time to reach equilibrium between the three phases before the start of degradation. A 100μl aliquot of a 3-day-old G4 culture was added to the ampules through an opening in the ampules and then immediately resealed. The controls were treated similarly but the G4 was not added.
